Reviews.Title: “A Disgrace for Italian Tourism”
Reviews.Author: Misho M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seiler illustrates a sad truth about tourism in Rome. If you have deep pockets, you can enjoy unbeatable quality. If you are on a tight budget, you will get what even cheap hotels in the Third World are ashamed to offer. I read that Seiler offered good value for money. Whoever came up with that has a very strange concept of good value. Seiler charges exorbitant prices for what it offers: officially 137 EUR per night for a room for two adults and a child. To top it off, as we checked out we were asked to pay another 6 EUR for each night that we had stayed - a so-called city tourist tax. So, what did we get for 146 EUR a night? A great location, to be sure. Seiler is within walking distance from most of the greatest sites in Rome. The beds were clean and comfortable (However, Americans may not agree with me as they have a different notion of a comfortable bed. I have read lots of American complaints about "hard beds" in hotels where I slept comfortably). There was hot water. There was toilet paper. The elevator worked. And that was it. Instead of towels, we got something like bed sheets. They changed them every other day or so. The bed linen was not changed even once although we stayed seven nights. The walls were moldy and stained. The wardrobe was full of a foul stench. The bathroom stank even worse, like a dead dog in the middle of August (Readers from countries with street dogs know what I am talking about). The shower cabin panel was broken and the bathroom flooded after each shower. The showerhead was broken and could not be hanged, so we had to hold it in one hand while showering. In the shower cabin, there was no place to leave the soap or the sponge: they had to be held in the other hand. The TV remote control did not work: judging from other reviews, this is typical of Seiler. They just can't be bothered to buy new batteries. The blow dryer was out of order but we managed to fix it. Yet, the worse thing was the walls. They seemed to be made of some kind of cardboard. So, when you neighbor flushes the bathroom in the middle of the night, it is as if somebody is doing that right in the middle of your room. If you understand your neighbors' language, you can follow their conversation. We had quiet neighbors the first six nights, except for the flushing that occurred at most improbably hours at night. The seventh night, we had a family with hysterical kids that would not go to bed until midnight. Breakfast consists more or less of good quality stuff but strictly rationed, except for the cornflakes. You get a small croissant, a small bun, two small crackers, and tiny servings of honey, jam, chocolate paste, and butter. More or less filling if you can eat this kind of food. They serve tea (real English tea, I think it was Pickwick) or coffee (also real and strong, not the diluted version you get in the US) or hot chocolate. Every morning, there was a puddle of water at the entrance to the dining hall: at Seiler the concept of washing does not include mopping up the floor. I guess if you slip and fall it will be your fault. So, here is the final verdict. If you absolutely insist on staying in the center of Rome but cannot afford anything decent, stay at Seiler or a similarly priced hotel. But be ready for hardships that you will not endure even in cheap hotels in Asia or Eastern Europe, where I come from. An absolute disgrace for Italian tourism and the authorities that supervise it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but Basic Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well situated for transport links, Reception staff very pleasant. Room was very compact and the access to the shower was very narrow - no room in shower to move around.( Beware of dropping the soap!!)

Reviews.Title: “There Is Far Better In Rome!”
Reviews.Author: wilhelmfink
Reviews.Content: This place is not worth the money at all. We arrived to be greeted by a rude lady at reception informing us that our room was not ready. As it was seven thirty in the morning & we are well travelled people we know the routine and explained we only wanted to leave our bags and come back for our 13:00 o'clock check-in. This was not a problem until we arrived back at 15:30 to be informed that our room was not ready and we would still have to wait as the excuses followed about why we had to wait longer. We explained that these are not our problems and we should not be inconvenienced any longer. We where given a room on the ground level right next to reception until our room was ready. Only to be told later that the hotel was full and we could not have the original room we had booked. Room 101 which we where stuck with, had... - No remote control - TV reception that did not work - Mold in the entire bathroom - Broken shower screens - Marks on the walls - Exposed wires hanging from the ceiling As we complained about the remote control two other guests came to reception to complain that there remote controls where not working either. This seemed to be a standard complaint at this hotel. We all had the display of pretending to care as batteries where changed and swapped around on various remote controls. None worked by the way and the problem was never fixed. Tomorrow, tomorrow we where told.."for now you change on TV" Not good enough! Also the breakfast area was in the basement next to a room containing a water heater that was leaking a spilling water all over the slippery tilled floor in the entire breakfast area. I nearly slipped over, lucky I had a chance to catch myself. This is very dangerous with only towels jammed against the door to try and stop the water and no signs of a slippery surface. The WiFi hardly worked and dropped out all the time and there was chewed bubble gum stuck to the walls in the lounge area. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED...LOOK ELSE WHERE!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but basic”
Reviews.Author: DrAOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location close to Republica/Termini and only 10 minutes walk from the main downtown sights. It is located on some floors of an elegant-looking old building, on a quiet street. Our room was very basic, but it was clean. As a place to sleep, then hit the sights, it was fine - and good vlaue for money. However, don't expect either luxury or good facilities - it has neither. Reception staff maids were welcoming and friendly. The continental breakfast was adequate and OK for the inclusive price.

Reviews.Title: “paradise in hotel seiler roma”
Reviews.Author: Zoidova belarus... m
Reviews.Content: so nice hotel on the heart of rome,was so easy for us to go any where by feet...we really had a so nice staying in this superior hotel,rooms was s clean,and all the rooms has airconditions,private bathroom,color tv,price so cheap for this hight quality,really we had a five stars quality and we paid just for 2 stars,also i want to thank so much the responsible of reception(AHMED),really he was so kind man and always he helped us to visit every where in rome,i will advise all my family and all my friends and my colleges to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You will survive”
Reviews.Author: Jouni49
Reviews.Content: As in most two-stars you will also survive in this small hotel, and we did not find anything really bad which would justify to say "do not go" or anything really good to recommend. The hotel location is good. If you do not have too much luggage you can walk the 6 or so city blocks from Termini (15 -20 minutes) or to go by taxi (5 minutes). From the airport a taxi takes about half an hour, we paid EUR 47 for the ride. The hotel is in a side street with little traffic or noise, and it feels all secure also at late night. There are dozens of smallish hotels in the same overall area. In case of Seiler you will not find any big hotel sign outside, so you shall have to find the street, the building number, locate a a smallish sign in the wall, push the button to get the solid wooden door opened, walk in the corridor, turn left, up the stairs, and there it is. You have several restaurants close by (I was surprised how expensive Rome is), and a working ATM money dispenser 5-10 min walk away (down the street, turn left at Via Nazionale, one block towards the Plaza, in the corner), and the Repubblica metro station is only in 10 min walking distance, very convenient. We took a 4 euros x person full day metro ticket, very convenient and economic way to travel in Rome. The hotel has no city maps, you better take yours. The hotel is tiny, the rooms very basic but more or less workable. The hotel has a wireless internet connection, which did not work in our room (neither at the reception) so you may not trust in it. The room did not have reading lamps, so if you like to read something at night it will strain your eyes. A smallish flat screen TV with Italian only channels. We did not have an air conditioning (a huge propeller in the roof), so I wounder how one could survive in a mid summer heat. A very basic continental breakfast which may get the eyes open (the coffee was good and strong) but does not feed you much. Us who live in an earthquake zone and are sensitive to sudden vibration may wake up early in the morning when the first passing underground metro trains shake the buildings. The staff was friendly enough and showed places, explained routes, called taxis (which come quickly) and so on. I think the price/quality relation is good if you are looking for a place to sleep in Rome, and I can't say that the neighboring two stars would be better or worse. Next time in Rome I will probably choose another hotel, to have a bit more comfort and in summer I would definitively wish to have an air conditioning .

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: Camelutza1
Reviews.Content: I've just came back from Rome!I've stayed at Seiler hotel for 6 nights!it was just great!The hotel is close to Termini station!we dropped off the airport bus at Termini and in 10 minutes walking we were at the hotel!The hotel is also 2 minutes walking distance from the metro stop- Piazza de la Republica!From this metro station there is 1 stop to Fontana di Trevi, 2 stops until Piazza di Spagna and 5 stops until Vaticano!We used the metro just when we went to Vaticano but for the others touristic points we went on foot because everything was very close to the hotel!The room was small and very clean and the space was enough for 2 persons,the toilet was clean, towels were changed every day!The hotel is great for the price we paid especially because when you get out of the hotel you are in the center of Rome,1 minute to Via Nazionale close to shops and restaurants!The breakfast is very simple but enough to get the strenght to walk all day long on the streets of Rome:croissants, honey, butter, jam adn chocolate cream,coffee, juice, milk with cereals!Even if it's a 2 stars hotel i recommend it 100% because of the location and the price that you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Was fine!!”
Reviews.Author: Tan-maintainer99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in February, and I found it basic but clean. It is in a perfect location to explore Rome walking distance to the termini, coliseum, Trevi etc. Only problem was after a week in Rome you are very tired and it was impossible to lie in past 9 as the walls were very thin and the maid is on a schedule, if you there for a brief city break this would not be an issue. Breakfast was basic continental but it is the same in most hotels Rome, I would return to this hotel again, in Rome all you need is a place to sleep. I recommend a restaurant called eletra in via principe a it was the best and most reasonably priced meal we had starter, beer wine main for 2 and dessert for 1 at no more than 50euro which is excellent as I found Rome had gotten more expensive than it was when I was there last Feb.

Reviews.Title: “An inexpensive hotel of good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Jacek_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed in room 303 for 7 nights in Feb 2011 in Seiler Hotel, Rome. The hotel has its own "spirit": location in the old aristocratic building of 1885, nice courtyard with sculpture, interesting marble staircase and interior decorations. We had a small but airy (high ceiling) and very clean room with bath, Towels were changed every day. Very friendly and helpful desk staff. Perfect location at small by-street in walking distance to many tourists destinations. Choice of restaurants and pizzerias nearby. Moreover: 2 min walk to metro at Piazza Republicca or bus stops at Via Nationale (quick access into any part of the city), 10 min walk to Termini station (shuttle to/from Fiumicino airport). I reccommend the stay there for tourists who do not look for luxuries but want spend several nights in a good budget hotel when sightseeing the attractions of the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Shirley095
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just good for our needs, value for money. I have been there twice in 2010 and both times were satisfied. There was nothing we will actually need more. The location was good for having walking tours around the historic city

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: SimonandTeresa
Reviews.Content: For what you pay it is a good hotel, in a great location and excellent value for money. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service for the Price…”
Reviews.Author: fie1
Reviews.Content: We booked a three bed room for three nights but only two of us ended up going. (See pictures for more details) Room size was fine for us as there were only two of us in a three/four bed room. I loved the location, approx 15-20 mins walk away from the coliseum, 10-15mins away from Trevi fountain, and we walked everywhere. They also insisted on us leaving our keys with them, cleanliness was fine and I can also confirm nothing was missing or touched. Staffs throughout the hotel seem nice although I did not speak to them apart from the basis greetings. Breakfast was basis however I knew this when I made the booking, which consisted of tea/coffee, milk, bread, cereals, nutella, honey, butter, jam and biscuit. Free colored map is provided, which is on the front desk, you just help yourself. We were in room 104, above the breakfast area, the walls are thin and if you are a light sleeper you can hear people’s chairs scraping the floor downstairs when they are getting up from their seats or sitting down in the morning although this did not bother us as we were getting up early as well and breakfast stars at 7.30am-9.30am, we could hear next door giggle in the evening but that was the only time we heard them. The room we were in, the beds are rather small so if you are tall, might be a problem for you however I don’t know if this applies to all the rooms, this was not a problem for us as I am 5’2. I did not suffer from any bed bugs however my sister who slept in the single bed next to me did on the 2nd and 3rd night, overall she had 5 bites and my thoughts were I hope she does not bring it back with her as it can be a nightmare to get rid of, so it’s a bit hit and miss. I don’t regret booking this hotel due to the location, as I wanted somewhere central with a decent price tag but the bed bugs were unfortunate.

Reviews.Title: “Find another !”
Reviews.Author: schnauzerqueen
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this one! Small rooms - not even a chair to put your clothes at night. Bathroom so small if you lost your soap in the shower- forget getting hold of it again! Breakfast like something probably served in jail - rationed ... one small piece of butter is what you get today! We had two lucky mornings out of six when they had forgotten to dilute the orange juice... A six-night stay - the fifth day they finally gave us clean bedlinen. After 30 years of experience with European hotels - this one is no 2 from the bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms ok.”
Reviews.Author: 20adams
Reviews.Content: The Seiler hotel isn't the most memorable thing about Rome. It isn't the best or the worst hotel you could stay in. When we got there we found our room was pretty much next to the lobby. I was worried we would be kept awake by people coming in all hours of the night. Actually it was quiet and we did manage to sleep. we were in room 105. It had a tiny window looking out over an alley which wasn't too pleasant. Also the celling fan was loose. we didn't dare turn it on as it shook wildly and we were afraid it was going to fall. Rome is hot and the lack of (safe) air conditioning was very noticeable! Breakfast wasn't wildly exciting and don't drink the coffee. It's foul. The good....The location was fantastic. we spent hours walking around Rome. it was 10-15 minutes to the Trevi fountain and the Pantheon. Hotel is open 24 hours Safe in the room. The shower was lovely and the bathroom was clean. 5 minutes from a metro station. Despar! all over Rome and within walking distance for cheap food. The odd...they insist you leave your room key at the front desk before you go out for the day. The key has a big keyring with the hotel name and room number and this is why they ask you to do it. However it also has the room safe key attached. This did unnerve me. However I will point out no personal possessions were touched. Bring a towel because the one they give you is tiny. Seiler was good for the money we paid. If you want luxury you won't get it here. If you want somewhere to sleep then Seiler is good. It's clean and it's comfortable. Location wise there isn't much better you could be.

Reviews.Title: “Low Price, good location, great service, but wouldn't want to do anything in the room but sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Coril77
Reviews.Content: My aunt, her 2 grandsons, my 8 year old, 5 year old, and 6 month old all traveled to Rome this summer. When searching for a hotel I was looking for something in a good location and a good price. We also needed parking as we were driving down from northern Italy. Very hard to find in Rome. Upon arriving we had a bit of an issue parking my big ol' American car. The spot they had was not big enough. The gentleman at the desk was able to recommend a parking garage literally around the corner which worked out fine. The rooms were typical European hotel rooms. Scuffed walls, run-down appearance, little furniture, and few of the comforts Americans are used to. TV's did not work, but we weren't in Rome to watch TV. No A/C, but we did have a fan without a cover (we traded with my aunt who had a fan with a cover in her room). Our room had carpet, my aunt's did not. My aunt's room also had a high cabinet with blankets spilling out of it. She couldn't get them back in to close the door. Breakfast was very basic-breads, rolls, croissants, jellys, nutella, cereal, milk, coffee, juice. The best part of the hotel was the service. Our beds were made and carpet vacuumed daily. The gentleman at the desk was fantastic at giving us advice on how to get around, and what to do. On his recommendation we booked a guided tour of the Vatican-so worth it. The Vatican is far away from the other sites, and can be very crowed and confusing to buy tickets. With the tour we didn't have to worry about any of that and saw all the highlights-Sistine Chapel, Tombs of the Popes, Saint Peter's Basilica, and St. Peter's Square. Although the hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to the majority of the sights, we also booked the hop-on, hop off bus on his recommendation. The only reason we did this is because of having the 5 kids and their ages. He also gave us a map of the city and told us some basics of Rome. While checking in things were taking awhile and he apologized and explained he was rearranging our room assignments. Originally our rooms were not close together, but he said with all the kids he thought it would be better if we were close. So, not only did he put us in rooms that were closer together but one of the rooms was also larger then what we booked at no extra charge. All of the staff-reception desk, and the ladies who served breakfast were extremely nice and helpful. If you are going to Rome and only plan to be in your room to sleep (and if you can overlook the appearance) this hotel may be what your looking for. If, however, you plan to spend some time in your room, then you will not be happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: mmw2578
Reviews.Content: Eaten alive by bedbugs, then moved to a room with non-working bathroom lights and broken shower doors with holes allowing water on the floor. Would not stay again on return trips or recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “College Dorm Roma!”
Reviews.Author: CupidandPsyche88
Reviews.Content: Seiler is one step above a hostel only because it has the advantage of a private bath. There was a working lift, which can’t be taken for granted in Italian hotels, and the room had its own heating/air conditioning unit and safe. Our double room was quite small; the shower had a fixed, high set shower head with low water pressure. Breakfast was basic: coffee, yogurt, croissant, Nutella. The walls are very thin: you will hear everything that happens on your floor: people coming and going, maids arguing, people in the rooms next door having a party and on their phone, etc. The hotel is steps from Termini Station and an easy walk to many of the major sites of Rome (the Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain, the Ancient Center); the Vatican is the only major point of interest not within walking distance. The building entrance and courtyard are surprisingly nice. Overall we liked our stay because the location was great and the place had a sort of college dormitory charm to it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: LoreenaCruel
Reviews.Content: Before choosing this hotel I read some of the reviews posted here and expected to have a terrible experience with this hotel, but it was not bad at all. The location is more than excellent, and in spite of the central position you can find a pretty cheap food shop walking around 5 min on Via Nazionale. It`s called Despar. When we arrived the staff decided to give us a room for 4 persons, although we were just 3, so more space. They were helpful, gave us lots of maps of Rome and showed us what we should visit each day and how to get there. After 2 nights they had to move us in another room, because a group of students has just arrived. It wasn`t an inconvenience, they moved all our baggage and the room was the best they had (room 405 if I remember well)! The bathroom was clean, they changed our towels daily, but the shower was a bit too small. No problems with hot water. The breakfast was too sweet from my point of view: honey, some chocolate, butter, croissant, milk, coffee, tea, cereals, jam, yogurt and a piece of cheese, they could have offered some ham, salami, but ok, I don`t complain since the aim of my trip wasn`t eating. Good price, the best we found for such a location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...rooms not so good”
Reviews.Author: nenka
Reviews.Content: I originally booked a room in the sister hotel but when I arrived, I was told that they had problems with rooms and that they booked the room at a different hotel (Seiler). I didn't have to pay extra, since there's about 18 euros difference in price for two nights. They even refunded my taxi fair. The location for Seiler Hotel is perfect if you want to explore Rome. It took me around a half hour to walk to Colosseum (I was stopping and taking pictures). It's about a 10 minute walk to Termini station, where you can catch a bus, metro, or a train. The lady at the front desk was extremely helpful. The elevator was working, which was a good thing since I was on the 4th floor. The room itself could definitely use updating. It was relatively clean but I chose not to walk around barefoot. The tv was not working. I didn't use the fan so I have no idea if it was in good condition or not. I guess you can't really expect much for the price. Bed was comfortable so that's a plus. Keep in mind that noise carries there. I had extremely noisy neighbors. I could hear them talking loudly until almost 1 am. Overall, an okay hotel. From what I understand, you would have to pay a lot more to have a better hotel, but for the money I paid, I thought it was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Renovated Bath, A/C, Location. A bargain!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gkmelgar
Reviews.Content: Hi, I reserved this hotel through the Airport of Rome office (since all the reviews that I read on different hotels, did not allow me to book none). For 40 euros a night, this was a bargain. Hotel was clean (rooms are small, but that is ok, you still have a small table). The bathroom wa completely renovated. All was nice. The only con is no internet. But at this price you can not complain. Definitely reccomended for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect any customer-friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Espinata
Reviews.Content: When we arrived they were cleaning the reception, when I put my arm on the desk of the reception they warned me, but too late .. the sleeve of my jacket was full of bleach stains. The hotel wasn't in any way prepared to contribute to the damage they caused. I really wouldn't have asked for the full price of the jacket (2 months old), but some compensation or a small discount on the hotel bill would have been enough.

Reviews.Title: “a really bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: gerasimos_st
Reviews.Content: We dont recommend it at all!Be careful before choosing it!Althourgh they say that the hotel has an elevator,the trouth is that the elevator is always out of service, so,you have to step to the 4th floor (107 stairs!)carrying all your luggage without help!They use to say that the problem of the elevator is "only for today",but they lie. Also,they retrench electricity so the stairs have no lights and the worst is that every morning when we wake up,there was no electricity in the room!we had to call everytime at the reception and to wait some minutes to fix the problem. The room was dirty and the breakfast very very simple.In the same area,which is very central,there are A LOT of hotels, try to find another one

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury but great location and great rates”
Reviews.Author: Travelhappy26
Reviews.Content: Anna - UK. I saw some of the other reviews on this hotel on tripadvisor before booking and they were all pretty mixed. To be honest my friend and i stayed for three nights and we couldn't ask for a better budget hotel. It is definitely a 2 star so you can't expect luxury and it isn't a massive breakfast (in case you wanted to save money on brekkie!) however it is in a fantastic location and a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum, Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The staff are really nice and the hotel feels safe with a buzzer entry after dark (24 hour reception). There aren't that many restaurants or shops right near the hotel but with such a short walk to everything it doesn't matter. We had booked a twin room but as they were quiet they switched us to a triple giving us extra space! Look no further for a great, cheap and central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service & good location at Seiler Roma”
Reviews.Author: Joannemcc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Seiler Dec 07 - I searched for the best price & location for a single traveller, and I think I found it. The staff were friendly, helpful & spoke english well. Main bus stops on Via Nazionale are a minute's walk away, and are the first stops after Termini on the 40 Express and 64 bus lines. I felt safe & central. Recommended for inexpensive centrally located stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but bad room condition”
Reviews.Author: Andyollings
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid to say I was a little disappointed with Hotel Seiler. I was travelling on a budget so therefore was not expecting too much but I do at least expect a clean room. The bathroom was tiny with mould on the walls, and there was filth collecting in the corners of the room and under the bed. From reading some of the other reviews it seems like this is not always the case but I would not stay here again or recommend this place to a friend. On the plus side, the hotel is in a great location close to Termini and the main sights, plus the room was quite large.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: geordieglenn
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, in a very good area (opposite the Italian Ministry of Defence) well kept and friendly staff. It is not a hotel for 'luxuries' but if you want a clean place to sleep then this is it. In walking distance of the colloseum and Vatican, good restaurants and bars in the area. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a clean and cheap hotel near all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “If you are on tight budget”
Reviews.Author: ItalyContributor
Reviews.Content: It was the worse hotel in our trip booked through the travel agency. I am not a picky person but... Room did not have phone (had thought an instruction how to make a call). Hair dryers are limited and you have to wait until spare one is returned to the service desk. Shelf in bathroom constanly flipped over and stuff fell into the sink. The only small window could slightly open to the... sewing system and was havily covered by dust. Breakfast was only bread with preserves and honey - no cheese, creem cheese, yogurt, fruits, etc that we had in other 2** hotels. Coffee - can't swallow. The good thing was - food store not too far from hotel The location can't be better - 3 min walk to the subway, walking distance (even with suitecases) to the train station. Consider this hotel ONLY if you are on tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “'You Get What You Pay For' Is A Great Rule When Travelling”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Naughton
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the reviews of this modestly priced centrally located hotel, situated off the Via Nazionale, and within easy walking distance of Termini Station, even with wheeled suitcases. Some of the reviewers, (travel newbies, I expect) complain about the room sizes and the amenities. Are the bedrooms small? "Si". Are they clean, and is the bed comfortable? "Si". Is there plenty of hot water and fluffy towels in the closet sized bathrooms? "Si". Are they luxury suites -- suitable for entertaining or for practicing your kungfu, martial arts, or ballroom dancing steps? "Definitely not." These are TOURIST CLASS rooms. You get what you pay for. if you want a larger room, book at any one of the nearby American style hotel brands. You'll get a larger room, you'll get your ham and eggs, and you will be presented with a much larger bill. We felt that the Seiler Hotel had an old-world ambience, splendid architectural details, charming courtyards, quaint views of the backs of nearby buildings in their terra cotta and other earth tones and shutters, breathtaking staircases, and friendly, multi-lingual staff. There was an elevator, suitable for one person with luggage, or two to three well acquainted persons without baggage. Togetherness is the key word for this elevator. It worked perfectly. The breakfast offered was perfectly adeqaute, if not large. I read that Italians don't eat much of a colazione (breakfast), but compensate at pranzo (lunch or dinner). The thing is, people must READ before they travel, so they know what to expect. I enjoyed my honey and Nutella with crusty rolls and croissants. I found the coffee deliciously strong, Fruit juices were available, and frankly-- this hotel, and breakfast, was everything I had come to expect. We have stayed in tiny rooms in London, and Paris, Florence, Venice, and New York City, and we know that you get what you pay for. If a hotel room is clean and comfortable, that's all we want. We like to spend our money on other things when travelling, such as opera tickets or spectacular meals. After a long, hard, happy day of discovering Roma, we found our little slice of heaven at the Seiler Hotel. I have no reservations about making a reservation there again. Jim Naughton Philadelphia

Reviews.Title: “Cancel Your Reservation”
Reviews.Author: itravel94
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump, plain and simple. Upon opening the door to our hotel room, I practically fell onto the bed because the room was so tiny. The room consisted of a double bed, 2 small bedside tables, and an armoire with a tiny television on top. There was no telephone in the room or alarm clock, so you better bring a device to wake you up in the mornings. There was no place to sit or even put our luggage. The bathroom was also tiny. The shower was ridiculously small and was in the center of the bathroom which means the floor gets soaked. There was a small window in the room, but it provided no light, because there was a layer of dust on both the screen and the window itself. Breakfast was typical, rolls with butter and spreads and a choice of coffee or tea. The one good thing I can say is that the location was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “It was adequate”
Reviews.Author: Cleanhotelplease
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel during Thanksgiving weekend. When we got into our room, we noticed it was pretty small...but my husband definitely noticed the really really small shower. If you drop your soap, you will have to get out of the shower to get it. We are not big people--average, but the shower was extremely small. A bit bigger than the elevator. So, in addition to the small room and small bathroom, the elevator will fit 3 regular sized people bunched together. On the good side, the hotel staff was pretty helpful, especially the young girl. She gave very detailed information and helpful with sites to check out. Also, the great thing about this hotel is that is it both near the metro and the train terminal so getting around was awesome. LOCATION WAS EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “i would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: suffolkbumpkin
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned to read the reviews AFTER I had booked the hotel, however I was very pleased with what I found. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff helpful and friendly, breakfast was fresh and the location meant easy walking to all the sights, all this and excellent value for money, I would recommend this hotel to other travellers

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: al__&__sl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in early November. We hastily booked through Expedia, and then read the various reviews......... needless to say we were somewhat apprehensive before going! When we got there the staff were really helpful and gave us their recommendations on what to see and which routes to take through the city. The location is fantastic, minutes from the Metro and Termini, and it's only a short walk to the Trevi Fountain and Pantheon. The rooms are a little small, but it was quiet, clean and had everything we needed. We didn't go to Rome to sit in a hotel room! If you are going for a short break and want something cheap and cheerful with a great location then this is the place for you...... If you want a 4 star hotel then maybe you should think about paying for one!

Reviews.Title: “What more do you want from a 2* ???”
Reviews.Author: veganise
Reviews.Content: First off, I have to say that for a listed 2-star rated accommodation, Hotel Seiler fulfilled most of its promises; a clean air-conditioned room, a fairly reasonable price, AND helpful, courteous staff on most occasions. If we were to ‘listen’ to some of the previous posts, we would certainly have missed an ideally situated bed & breakfast. We stayed for 10 days in early September 2006 , in a place we principally used to: a) Sleep b) ---- and shave (well my partner, did her version of the latter) c) Freshen up and .. d) Eat breakfast before we were off to enjoy the sites of Rome. Ok, the breakfast was basic; rolls, crispbreads, spreads, pot of coffee OR tea….and juice – if you asked for it. You could also have refills, of course. The hotel is within easy walking to the Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Piazza del Popolo AND Termini, it’s practically in the middle of most things on your particular ‘to-see-and-do’ list. Mind you we walked everywhere and the places where we used public transport (metro, bus) well, just stroll outside and head for Via Nazionale and take your pick. For the price – it’s fine. We were on the fourth floor at the rear of the building, in a room con doccia (a tight one, with extractor fan and occasional low water pressure), tv, and air-con. The windows and ac appear to be newly fitted. Oh, and no traffic noise. I have to mention the two single beds pushed together – vigorous activity could separate the two ;-) So, what’s all the fuss about? We'd use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Pits (An Absolute Dump)”
Reviews.Author: A-Wildgoose
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed 3 nights in this cesspit. We were put into a room in the basement that had no natural light ,you couldnt open the door fully and had to climb over the bed to get in. The bathroom or shower was unserviceable and the only ventilation was through a filthy hopper window that opened onto the sewers. When the toilets were used we got the smell from it. We complained to management who did nothing for 24 hours other than allow us to use the shower in another room that was also in the basement and had no fire escape. There was rubbish stacked in the adjacent alcove. We were moved to an equally dirty room the following morning on an upper floor and told to stop complaining. Breakfast was stale bread rolls n lousy coffee. The only reason we stayed was because it was pre booked by our travel agent in Australia. If I rated it I would give it a big 0 (Zero) for everything. If you are wondering why it has taken over 12 months to submit a review I couldn't have written it politely or civilly before now. Adrian G Australia

Reviews.Title: “The PIts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No air, no TV, no light bulbs. No good. Too much money for too little. Breakfast was coffee, tea or hot chocolate and a few rolls. I asked for water and it came in a plastic cup. 1/2 mile from train station is the best I can say for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a GREAT experience at this hotel! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location is absolutely perfect. We had already stayed in London and Paris on this trip and Hotel Seiler was a breath of fresh air. It is NOT in a bad part of town! It is 1 block from the metro station that will take you to all the things you want to see in Rome. Our room was large (2 twin beds and a double bed) The bathroom was clean and large (compared to our other experiences) The building was old, but extremely clean and well kept. I would definitely stay there again with my children should I take another trip to Rome (and I will!)

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Was Disguisting!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The pictures i had seen were nothing compared to what the room really looked like, as you can see from our pictures. There was NO air conditioning in the room. The room was dirty and you could not open the shutters on the window as people look in from offices opposite the room. There was no room for luggage and no table. Bathroom needed a refurb. The bed sheets were torn and ripped and felt very un clean. The Cleaner who cleans the rooms and toilets also serves the poor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE - SLEAZY AND DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: TerriS
Reviews.Content: The room was very small - maybe an old closet converted to a room?? The walls had "rust" colored spots all over it, I was hoping that they were from dead bugs instead of human blood. The wooden door had a very large hole in it that had been poorly repaired with cheap plywood - but you could still see out into the hallway while laying in bed because the repair job left huge holes. Frequent comings and going of very loud, very drunk men and women at all hours of the night....I got the feeling that we were in the red-light district. This is the kind of place that I would expect to find bugs. Disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed here - first visit to Rome. First time travelled alone too. This hotel provided me with everything I required to have a hassle free, friendly stay in Rome. The room was clean, well presented and the bathroom was more than adequate. The staff - well - were very helpful, provided excellent first class service and spoke perfect English too. The location was right in the heart of Rome, near to all travel options, station, buses or withing walking distance to all attractions. I walked my socks off! Recommend this hotel to singletons such as myself!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Great Value...”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2012London
Reviews.Content: Excellent 2 star hotel (try to get one like this at the same price in London!!!)...very clean, helpful and nice people at reception...close to all amenities and Rome highlights...you can easily walk from there to anywhere...had a great time and would stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Nice people, cheap in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good memories about this hotel. -Old building but renewed. Nice stairways, reception. It´s near the center of the city (fontana trevi 10 min) and termini station(10min). Brekfast not buffet but good quality and ammount. Very nice staff. Always prepared to help you in anything you need. Great value for money. Cons: Small rooms. Not air aconditionated Very Very Tiny bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Beware of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: youngcoupleNMGG
Reviews.Content: Do not book with at this hotel if you want to have a hassle free holiday. Pre booked at this hotel for two night and on arrival were notified that our room will not be ready until the second night due to ongoing building work. Were moved to another hotel not far away for one night. On returning to the Seiler hotel the following day we were put in a room on the 4th floor which was being referbished. Had to walk through a dusty building site to get to our room. The room itself had dust on the bed, table and floor, there were cement footprints in the room from the builders. The radiator was half painted, the bathroom was aweful, the toilet seat was cracked and the shower was a pathetic dribble. I advise never to book at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MBarr
Reviews.Content: Location is good close to the terminus but the hotel is not what it was advertised as. Despite the good location the rooms are very small, the bathroom was disgusting with mould on the roof and tiles missing on the floor providing a trap for unweary toes. Meals were average in the breakfast room and the desk although helpful was missing most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “The most horrible place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Seiler hotel. If anyone is concerned about their health and well being this would not be the place stay. In the heat of July there were no air conditioner,we were told that there were only five air conditioned rooms in this entire hotel. The room was not cleaned for three days that we stayed there, clean towels were not available, we were notified that they were only changed every two days, I resorted to helping myself to clean towel and toilet paper from the maid's closet after timing her going to clean some of the rooms that guests checked out from. The toilet was practically in the shower, you had to be pretty limber to get to it. The shower was two feet by two feet , with an entrance of about eighteen inches,you hang one half of your body out of the shower while washing the other half. the shower was mold infested and you pretty much stood in dirty water while showering from lack of proper drainage. Our electricity went out one night and no one knew how to fix it, I found the breaker box behind a door leaving the room and fixed it myself the next morning. Try calling the front desk from your room there was never any answer. Get dressed and go down there and there is always someone complaining about something. The manager of this hotel was the most inconsiderate and rudiest person I have ever come across in a business that caters to guests. I consistently went down to his desk and requested a room that had some air conditioner, due to the fact that my husband has had a heart attack and hypertension among other health related issue and this condition was not fit for him, although one of his employee was very compassionate and requested that the manager help us out, he refused to. Needless to say we left for Florence at of three days and by the time we got there my husband had to be seen emergently for exhaustion due to the heat and ultimately sleep deprivation. We came back to Rome and found another hotel to stay in. Hotel Seiler is in a very convenient part of Rome however it is one of the worst experiences I have had in my travel history. There are many other hotels in this area that are in the same price range or even less, that caters to their guests and also have very friendly staff members that care.

HotelInfo.Name: Seiler Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Firenze, 48, 00185 Rome, Italy
